page.title: 06The Provost, Ceres
page.content:
When a stone figure of the last person in the Ceres Provostry, the Rev.Thomas Buchanan, was sold in 1933, the people of Ceres wanted it back and so they recovered it and placed 'The Provost' in a prominent position alongside a carved panel by the same sculptor, John Howie, showing a scene from the Battle of Bannockburn.
This edifice is clearly seen by all visitors and is considered the heart of the village of Ceres.
The residents are proud of their historical connections and are not keen to have changes which would spoil the beauty of the village and break their link with Scottish history.
